snippet: The question of whether Steven A. Cohen, whose company, SAC Capital Advisors, pleaded guilty to insider trading charges, should sell his minority partnership of the Mets has surfaced.
abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column says the question of whether Steven A Cohen, whose company, SAC Capital Advisors, pled guilty to insider trading charges, should sell his minority partnership of the New York Mets has surfaced; Cohen has not been personally charged by the government, but he has been tainted by the conduct of his company.
lead_paragraph: The question of whether Steven A. Cohen, whose company, SAC Capital Advisors, pleaded guilty to insider trading charges, should sell his minority partnership of the Mets has surfaced.

headline.main: The Mets’ Delicate Dance With a Billionaire
headline.print_headline: The Mets’ Delicate DanceWith a Billionaire
